data.title: Well above the rest of bis
data.text:
We stopped in later on a week night and we're very happy we did.  Their beer selection was ok, skewed towards IPA's.  The food was very good and a diverse menu.  The bread and salad to start all tasted fresh.  I had the crab cake, it was just a touch on the salty side but it was full of crab meat and cooked well.  We skipped desert because we were both full.  Service was good, we did not get our appetizer but I'm guessing he missed it because I was also asking questions about the menu.  Our server was very helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.  Of all the restaurants in bismarck, I cannot name a better one to go to.
Negatives - I would have liked to have seen a broader range of beer selection.  Thought the place was a touch noisy for my taste.  Service was above average for bismarck, but could have been better in some areas.

data.title: An outpost of culinary civilization arrives on the High Plains
data.text: Actual fine dining comes to Bismarck. Having recently moved here from one of the country's great restaurant towns (Houston), our dining out experiences have mostly been disappointing. Food here is generally expensive (even in the store), so one often ends up paying more for mediocre food and service than one would like. The opposite is the case at J60, which opened over the summer. First, unlike most Bismarck dining establishments, J60 has excellent front of the house management. The manager, Paulie, is in evidence every night keeping a sharp eye on things and meeting his customers. They make a lot in house - like the excellent bread which arrives with two spreads and the vinaigrette for the salad which contains real live olive oil. The salad, by the way, comes with your meal and is tossed tableside, which is a nice touch. My husband and I have been twice and this is now our go to restaurant. We've sampled the smoked salmon appetizer, the crab cake appetizer (accompanied by arugula/apple salad), delicious beef stroganoff and sautéed scallops with black rice. All were top notch and by local standards, very reasonably priced. Service was better than average - our waiter got us out in time the make the symphony on our second visit - and getting better as the wait staff gets more experienced. All in all this place is a winner and I hope they can stay in business!

data.title: Another great restaurant in Bismarck!
data.text: The atmosphere is very modern though it did seem pretty loud.  There were booths and I'm guessing it would've been quieter in a booth.  The menu had a lot of great options and we couldn't decide on just one appetizer so decided to have two.  The carpaccio wasn't what we were expecting - generally it's cut so thin that you can see through it but this was a rather thick piece of meat.  It as very good.  Our entrees were excellent as were the drinks.  Their drink menu has a lot of unique and fun options.  It was pretty expensive but it was a great night out and we will be back!!

data.title: Nice new place in Bismarck!
data.text: J60 is a new game in town. The space is small and I am not sure if they take reservations but if they do I would suggest you make one. My wife and I went for our anniversary and all tables were full. We waited at the bar and the bartender was very helpful on the drink selection. She offered up some samples to help select a good craft beer. After getting the booth our waiter seemed a bit confused about the transition between the bar and restaurant, not sure why. The food was fair, but not as good as the prices suggest. There are many unique selections on the menu that you won't find anywhere else.

data.title: Food was fair, little over the top. But fruit flies made it awful.
data.text:
We love when a new restaurant opens up in town. Very nice interior. After a long wait for somebody to seat us the wait staff was very good. We orderd many appetizers and one meal. Most appetizers looked great. A few were cold..... But most had great favors but a few had to many things going on. As for the meal it was the crab cakes on a bed of rice. Problem is that is was not a crab CAKE. It was a heap of crab cake type of substance plopped on the rice then baked. So the top had a little crust but the middle and bottom of the crab cake was soggy. It should have been a crab cake that was fried then placed on the rice. Crab cakes are fried on both sides. 
The other problem was we kept having fruit flies all around us. Makes a person somewhat uneasy about how clean the restaurant is.

data.title: New and Great
data.text: we were a party of seven we had dinner at this restuarant and every one of us really enjoyed our meal. We had steaks, Salmon, and pasta's everything was great. The bar was very exceptional and offered a variety of beers, and mixed drinks. the Amosphere was very modern and nice. The service was great. This restaurant is newly opened and Im sure that once the word gets out it will be the place to be.

data.title: New and Great
data.text: This restuarant is newly opened, it is very nice and has a modern look, the food is excellent, and the service was very good and friendly. I group of 7 of us ate here and all of us really liked our food. We will all return again. I had the salmon which was excellent. The place wasn't busy the night we were there, but once the word gets out this place will be packed.

data.title: Update and clean
data.text: We had a family dinner here, every one enjoyed there meal. I had the grilled Salmon and it was very delicious. They also serve drinks here and they were also very refreshing. We were al l glad we ate here and would go again. the Atmosphere was also very nice, we were able to visit and hear every one. Very nice resturant
